en.sc1: Consider searching for the record with key value 32 in this tree via contains(). We call the private contains helper method with a pointer to the BST root (the node with key value 37).
en.sc2: Check what node is pointing to. It is not null.
en.sc3: Check the value at the current node. We find that value=32 is less than the value at the current node.
en.sc4: So we want to visit the left child.
en.sc5: We make a recursive call with the left child as the new node.
en.sc6: Check the value at the current node. We find that value=32 is greater than the value at the current node.
en.sc7: So we want to visit the right child.
en.sc9: We make a recursive call with the right child as the new node.
en.sc11: Check the value at the current node. This is the record that we are looking for.
en.sc12: Now we will start unwinding the recursion, passing the return value true back up to the caller.
en.sc13: Pop the recursion, now node is back to the node with value 24.
en.sc14: Pop the recursion, now node is back to the node with value 37.
en.sc15: Pop the recursion one final time to return the return value true back to the original caller of contains().
en.sc16: Check the value at the current node. We find that it is not greater than what we are looking for.
en.sc17: Check the value at the current node. We find that it is not equal to what we are looking for.
